content: this is the worsted weight version of my long flap fingerless mitts with some improvements i have incorporated some shaping to address the problem with bulk in the wrist area long flap fingerless mitts worsted weight version yarn worsted weight yarn approx 130 yards the example shown was made with malabrigo rios in lettuce needle size 8 - 32 up to 40 circular needles for magic loop - whatever length cord you are comfortable with for magic loop gauge 5 stitches to the inch size medium 6 to 7 hand measurement or large 8 to 9 hand measurement - stitch count for large will be in parenthesis k2p2 rib - knit 2 stitches purl 2 stitches pm - place marker sm - slip marker k2tog - insert the right needle from front to back as if knitting into the next 2 stitches on the left needle and knit the 2 stitches as if they were one stitch m1r - insert the left needle from the back to front under the bar between the stitches knit the stitch through the front loop m1l - insert the left needle from the front to the back under the bar between the stitches knit the stitch through the back loop k1p1 rib - knit 1 stitch purl 1 stitch directions loosely cast on 36 stitches 18 stitches on each needle for size medium loosely cast on 40 stitches 20 stitches on each needle for size large this is the way that i lock in my stitches before knitting in the round you can substitute any technique that you are comfortable with holding the two needles parallel to each other pass first stitch on left needle over to the right needle pass 2nd stitch on right needle over 1st stitch that you just put there and over to the left needle this locks the stitches together so you can begin knitting in the round be careful not to twist the stitches rounds 1 - 10 k2p2 rib round 11 you will be decreasing 6 stitches on this round decrease 4 stitches on needle 1 and 2 stitches on needle 2 needle 1 - k2 3 k2tog k2 k2tog k2 k2tog k2 k2tog k2 3 needle 2 - k4 5 k2tog k6 k2tog k4 5 rounds 12 - 19 knit to end of round round 20 you will be increasing 6 stitches on this round increase 4 stitches on needle 1 and 2 stitches on needle 2 needle 1 - k2 3 m1r k2 m1r k6 m1l k2 m1l k2 3 needle 2 - k4 5 m1r k8 m1l k4 5 rounds 21 - 28 knit begin thumb increases on needle 1 increasing a total of 8 stitches round 29 k1 m1r k1 m1l k1 pm - k to end of round round 30 knit round 31 k2 m1r k1 m1l k2 sm - k to end of round round 32 knit round 33 k3 m1r k1 m1l k3 sm - k to end of round
